result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barry R. Gilbert

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:55 PM Defendant Barry R. Gilbert in court with attorney Cana G Kohn, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kohn has copy of compliant, waives reading, bond set and posted and waives time limits for p.h.  Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02:55 PM Defendant Barry R. Gilbert in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case and review case status report.  Def. wishes to continue to wait. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:01 PM Defendant Barry R. Gilbert in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court review history of cae. Def. applied for P.D. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Barry R. Gilbert
Current: 207 S Park St, Merrill, WI 54452   (Effective: 04-11-2022)
Prior: 1125 1/2 Arthur Street, Wausau, WI 54403
No contact with alleged victim or residence or any place alleged victim occupied.

03:00 PM Defendant Barry R. Gilbert in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Def. already contacted P.D. and is eligible. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. heard on bond. Court orders $150 cash bond, no contact with alleged victim or residence or any place victim occupied.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
